definition: Total tin (Sn)."Total" indicates was measured on a whole water (unfiltered) sample.

name: Titanium dioxide
definition: Titanium dioxide, also known as titanium(IV) oxide or titania, is the naturally occurring oxide of titanium, chemical formula TiO  2. When used as a pigment, it is called titanium white, Pigment White 6 (PW6), or CI 77891.

name: Topographic Wetness Index (TWI)
definition: Topographic wetness index (TWI), also known as the compound topographic index (CTI), is a steady state wetness index. It is commonly used to quantify topographic control on hydrological processes.

name: TSI
definition: Carlson Trophic State Index is a measurement of eutrophication based on Secchi depth

name: Ultraviolet Radation Index
definition: The global solar UV index (UVI) was developed as an easy-to-understand measure of biologically effective UV radiation with a view to promote public awareness of the risks of UV radiation exposure and sun protection. In the initial work done on UVI in Canada, a typical midday summer erythemal irradiance of 250 mW.m-2 was found leading to the (arbitrary) definition of one UV index equal to an erythemally weighted irradiance of 25 mW.m-2. This gives a typical range of UVI 0 to 11+.

name: Ultraviolet Radiation Dose
definition: A measure of the ability of ultraviolet radiation, as a function of wavelength, to produce just perceptible erythema in human skin.

name: Uranium, dissolved
definition: Dissolved Uranium. For chemical terms, dissolved indicates a filtered sample.

name: Uranium-234
definition: An isotope of uranium in the uranium-238 decay series

name: Uranium-235
definition: An isotope of uranium that can sustain fission chain reaction

name: Vanadium, dissolved
definition: Dissolved vanadium (V). "Dissolved" indicates the measurement was made on a filtered sample.

name: Vanadium, total
definition: Total vanadium (V). "Total" indicates was measured on a whole water (unfiltered) sample.

name: Vapor pressure
definition: The pressure of a vapor in equilibrium with its non-vapor phases

name: Vapor pressure deficit
definition: The difference between the actual water vapor pressure and the saturation of water vapor pressure at a particular temperature.

name: Vegetation type
definition: Vegetation is an assemblage of plant species and the ground cover they provide.

name: Velocity
definition: The velocity of a substance, fluid or object

name: Vermiculite
definition: Vermiculite is a hydrous phyllosilicate mineral. It undergoes significant expansion when heated. Exfoliation occurs when the mineral is heated sufficiently, and the effect is routinely produced in commercial furnaces.

name: Volume
definition: Volume. To quantify discharge or hydrograph volume or some other volume measurement.

name: Volumetric water content
definition: Volume of liquid water relative to bulk volume. Used for example to quantify soil moisture

name: Watchdog error count
definition: A counter which counts the number of total datalogger watchdog errors

name: Water column equivalent height, absolute
definition: The absolute pressure (combined water + barometric) on a sensor expressed as the height of an equivalent column of water.

name: Water column equivalent height, barometric
definition: Barometric pressure expressed as an equivalent height of water over the sensor.

name: Water Content
definition: Quantity of water contained in a material or organism

name: Water depth
definition: Water depth is the distance between the water surface and the bottom of the water body at a specific location specified by the site location and offset.

name: Water depth, averaged
definition: Water depth averaged over a channel cross-section or water body.  Averaging method to be specified in methods.

name: Water level
definition: Water level relative to datum. The datum may be local or global such as NGVD 1929 and should be specified in the method description for associated data values.

name: Water potential
definition: Water potential is the potential energy of water relative to pure free water (e.g. deionized water) in reference conditions. It quantifies the tendency of water to move from one area to another due to osmosis, gravity, mechanical pressure, or matrix effects including surface tension.

name: Water Use
definition: Water pumped to be used in an undefined way.

name: Water Use, Commercial + Industrial + Power
definition: Water pumped by commercial, industrial users.

name: Water Use, Domestic wells
definition: Water pumped by domestic wells; residents and landowners not using public supply. Nonagriculture wells.

name: Water Use, Public Supply
definition: Water supplied by a public utility

name: Water Use, Recreation
definition: Recreational water use, for example golf courses.

name: Wave height
definition: The height of a surface wave, measured as the difference in elevation between the wave crest and an adjacent trough.

name: Well flow rate
definition: Flow rate from well while pumping

name: Wellhead pressure
definition: The pressure exerted by the fluid at the wellhead or casinghead after the well has been shut off for a period of time, typically 24 hours

name: Wind chill
definition: The effect of wind on the temperature felt on human skin.

name: Wind Run
definition: The length of flow of air past a point over a time interval. Windspeed times the interval of time.

name: Wind stress
definition: Drag or trangential force per unit area exerted on a surface by the adjacent layer of moving air

name: Xylosidase
definition: An enzyme with system name 4-beta-D-xylan xylohydrolase.[1][2] This enzyme catalyses the following chemical reaction: Hydrolysis of (1->4)-beta-D-xylans, to remove successive D-xylose residues from the non-reducing termini.

name: Ytterbium
definition: Ytterbium is a chemical element with symbol Yb and atomic number 70. It is the fourteenth and penultimate element in the lanthanide series, which is the basis of the relative stability of its +2 oxidation state.

name: Ytterbium, dissolved
definition: Dissolved Ytterbium (Yb). "Dissolved " indicates a the measurement was made on a filtered sample.

name: Yttrium
definition: Yttrium is a chemical element with symbol Y and atomic number 39. It is a silvery-metallic transition metal chemically similar to the lanthanides and has often been classified as a "rare-earth element".

name: Yttrium, dissolved
definition: Dissolved Yttrium (Y). "Dissolved " indicates a the measurement was made on a filtered sample.

name: Zinc
definition: Zinc is a chemical element with symbol Zn and atomic number 30. It is the first element in group 12 of the periodic table. In some respects zinc is chemically similar to magnesium: both elements exhibit only one normal oxidation state (+2), and the Zn2+ and Mg2+ ions are of similar size. Zinc is the 24th most abundant element in Earth's crust and has five stable isotopes. The most common zinc ore is sphalerite (zinc blende), a zinc sulfide mineral. The largest workable lodes are in Australia, Asia, and the United States. Zinc is refined by froth flotation of the ore, roasting, and final extraction using electricity (electrowinning).

name: Zinc, distribution coefficient
definition: Ratio of concentrations of zinc in two phases in equilibrium with each other. Phases must be specified.

name: Zinc, total
definition: Total zinc (Zn)."Total" indicates was measured on a whole water (unfiltered) sample.

name: Zirconium
definition: Zirconium is a chemical element with symbol Zr and atomic number 40. The name zirconium is taken from the name of the mineral zircon, the most important source of zirconium.

name: Zirconium-95
definition: A radioactive isotope of zirconium with a half-life of 63 days
